channel.title: Versitile desktop tower?
channel.description: I have plenty of shit desktops laying around, all not working (could make quite a few work via swapping parts from one to the other). I am thinking of buying a basic desktop tower to turn into a 'server' of sorts. The main thing I don't know, is what towers are best. I just know brands, and how well they are known. Does anybody know of a cheap ass tower that is fairly versatile and upgradeable? Looking on newegg, but the only towers i seem to like the looks of are about $200 or more.

item.title: Versitile desktop tower?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Elijah:

Then why the fuck did you post a topic about a subject we don’t give a shit about. Especially since you seem to have already found the Desktop you were looking for.

Maybe because at the time, I had not found one?

[quote=“Unhandled, post:18, topic:367478”]I am so fucking confused as to the topic of this thread right now.

I recommend delete.[/quote]
God, that wasn’t hard at all.

item.title: Versitile desktop tower?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Thug-life:

He isn’t spending $82 on a case, he is spending $82 on a refurbished desktop computer. That is what this post is seemingly about. Not buying just a case, but a computer.

Thank you, I have plenty of parts to upgrade it, main reason I wanted a refurbished computer because it would be cheaper than buying a new mobo sometimes. Well, as long as you know where to look

item.title: Versitile desktop tower?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:

thus why I am looking for a desktop tower, and not a case.
[/quote]
Wait what. You’re a fucking idiot, go waste $200 on something you don’t need now thanks.[/quote]
Don’t plan on spending any more than $100 actually. The computer up at the local store is only $82, and is actually decent specs for the price. Cheaper than the motherboards I was looking at, so in actuality, I just saved myself some cash. Thank you come again.

item.title: Versitile desktop tower?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Unhandled:

Do you even fucking understand what a case is? The motherboard isn’t permanently welded to it…

I cba to build from a completely empty case, thus why I am looking for a desktop tower, and not a case. I seem to have found a refurbished desktop for $82 I am thinking about.

http://salestores.com/hphewl19.html

Its at a local store around me that its $82, they fail to have a website or I would put link to that. But that is the exact same thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Versitile desktop tower?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:7, topic:367478”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=463641.msg3391810#msg3391810 date=1289004601]

Why the fuck do you need a new case for a sever machine?

Most of the cases I have, the owners and fucked up. Just so you can estimate, Out of the like 40 desktops I have sitting in my garage, only 10 have motherboards currently in one piece. Psycho much? Anyways, Even out of those 10 mobo’s, only about 3-4 are usable. The main reason I am not using them, is because they have slow slow processors (1.2-1.8GHz) that is not upgradeable. The parts inside of them though, are newer. One of them had a fairly nice graphics card inside that I use in my desktop.

Graphics card:
http://www.nvidia.com/object/geforce_8400.html
[/quote]
Doesn’t answer the question though, why do you need a new case for a server machine?[/quote]
It should answer the question fine.
“The main reason I am not using them, is because they have slow slow processors (1.2-1.8GHz) that is not upgradeable. The parts inside of them though, are newer”
Taken right from it.

Read full topic
